gtSuevXUJUNHo1HlYeUk_Q.text: Fantastic, affordable, quick lunch with great Scottish fare and plenty of options I would say most Americans would be happy with (steak, chicken, salmon).  I had haggis starter and chicken main.  Both very good. They have a 2 course lunch special for 10.95!

M2sPquG5ODUhafns0cNyrg.text: I'm all for paying the right price for meals. With promise of locally sourced, gourmet prepared dishes- I was very willing to fork out.   While the food was decent, but a couple of things really threw me for a spin and I felt jibbed by my 35 meal;  - there is a balance between attentive serving, and passive aggressively rushing. Yes, I walked in off the street and obviously a tourist... But I should not have been rushed. Case in point: there was a server standing next to me watching me take my last bite- for all 3 courses! - so they can take the plates away immediately  - 3.95 for two half slices of bread and a pad of butter? Seriously? That better have been Himalayan pink salt on the butter, otherwise I call it a hidden service charge   - the waitress working my table, I suspect, has English as her second language. Well guess what, me too. I guessed it was language/ cultural barrier but in hospitality there is no reason to open the dialogue with "are you ready to order". Really- the very first thing she said to me was that. No hello/ good evening/ how are you  - there was not a lick of green vegetable in both my Cullen Skink, or my lamb roast. Maybe some chopped herb garnishes. Meal was all starch and protein. The end.   - dessert menu was boring. If you've ever spoke to an executive chef with no experience or interest in pastry, they will always put simple faithful a like fruit crumble, panna cotta and cheesecake on a dessert menu. This is what Howie's offered  Well it's not all doomed. Their meat dish and the lamb gravy was divine. Wish there was more gravy though.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate black cherry bread-butter pudding. Bit of an ol faithful in dessert world. Nice balance of sweet/ sour. Not inspiring
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb dish. Tasty. Not enough gravy or green matter to balance
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cullen Skink (smoked fish white chowder)

FxaRBe57ojh6O4_rOPr5pQ.text: Howies is a fantastic restaurant. It is the definition of Scottish dining. Fresh food and cooked to perfection. I had salmon with samphire. I will definitely be returning to the restaurant as the staff were extremely lovely and so was the food!

9kX0cWeXEOBro_RLq3AIIQ.text: Delicious! There was a nice selection of daily specials and the regular menu. The bread basket was also yummy. My favorite past of the meal was the sticky toffee pubbing, which was in a sweet, satisfying pool of caramel.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding

3KSFhmWVT2q4CV4p2YUYHQ.text: Great service, drinks and food.  Our family of 7 had a wonderful meal here after a long and hot day of touring the sites in  Edinburgh.  Every dish we ordered was amazing, and the whiskey flights were fun for the group to sample.

pvt8yLO1wJipPbmEnMyyrg.text: Howie's. Usually a place for either a cheesesteak or a pastrami on rye. But not here at this Howie's. Who would a thought that Howie is a Scottish name? McHowie's, maybe, or the Laird of Howie, but it is what it is. A short walk from the Scotsman Hotel on the scenic Grass Market, this was a great meal! We managed to avoid the black pudding (sausage made from pig blood - I'll pass) and had a fine meal, starting with skink. This is not the slinky skink with a long tail - it's a chowder made with smoked haddock. Way excellent. Also, a chicken breast stuffed with sundried tomatoes and red peppers couldn't have been better. A little noisy (the venue, not the chicken...), but not overbearingly so.  If I ever get back to Edinburgh, which is doubtful, I'll definitely hit Howie's up for more skink. But give it a try...it beats the McDonalds (another Scottish restaurant) up the block.

YNRB_oUfU4JWcv6jjioTLA.text: A real gem on Victoria Street - and I've been to the one at Waterloo Place and can verify that is equally as good.   The lunch menu here is perfect - two courses for just over a tenner. The service is professional and friendly. I opted for the chicken breast on a cabbage bed with mash potato, followed by banoffee pie. Everything was delicious.   The range of food on offer is excellent considering this is a lunch menu. All ingredients are locally sourced and fresh. Definitely recommended.

zXE0OOR3WGT5iCHwOvhncg.text: Squeezed us it even though we didn't have a reservation. Busy place. Servings are a bit small so definitely get a starter. Great staff! Food was out fast and delicious.

R4xpQLMheN0iP89T-4tg9w.text: Great experience: food, ambiance and service were all top-notch. We arrived for lunch without a reservation but were seated right away. Food was delicious; everything down to and including the bread&butter was flavorful with portions that were generous but not outrageous. Location is lovely: restaurant is a series of connected rooms, each with big windows and antique furniture accents. Great mix of clientele, from families to romantic couples. Close to major attractions in Edinburgh, but did not feel touristy. Would definitely come here again. Fantastic value!

veFLk7n1dYXUcnBz5UaaNw.text: Howies beautifully presents delicious flavours of Scotland in generous portions served by smiley happy staff at reasonable prices in a warm, minimalistic setting.  I had a trio of salmon to start - locally hot smoked salmon pate, single malt whisky cured salmon gravadlax, seared smoked salmon with a fennel & citrus dressing; main of grilled fillet of locally smoked hake with sauteed new potatoes, chorizo & spinach and dessert of chocolate truffle and Oloroso whiskey torte with summer berry compote.  I don't eat in Scottish restaurants enough and Howies is reason to do so more often!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Uv_B6HeL4C3Z9PAocv7Jhw.text: Amazing amazing amazing cultik skink.  They are supper nice and the food is spectacular.

dk8966NGsCayxisSKeEs9A.text: 5 star local food at 3 star prices - go there now!  Absolutely fantastic local food at a brilliant price. The best restaurant we visited during our festival weekend stay.  Amazing service too!

Q9_XEbHR_e6ikVeMqjT7Kw.text: We tried haggis for the first time (have to try the local foods) and it was very good.  We'll be interested to see if others are as nicely textured & seasoned as Howies. The service was very good & the atmosphere friendly.  We visited with two other tables of guests.

6cR1G1h8uRLOKNVDWrSTWg.text: The hubby and I popped into Howie's around noon on new years day after unsuccessfully attempting to eat at Oink (again, for the six time).   The space is awesome - the owner told me it was a stable in it's old life. It's nicely decorated and since we were there over the holidays, they had a tree and some other Christmassy decorations arranged throughout the restaurant. Upon entering, you will be greeted by one of the many smiling staff and with the smell of delicious coffee and food.   Their two-course lunch offering was something we simply could not refuse. At 9.95, it was a steal. Included was either a starter and main or main and dessert. The husband and I opted for the starter/main option.   They offer daily specials which are detailed on a big black chalkboard hung high in the dining room. You know, pie of the day, casserole of the day, fish of the day, drink of the day. You get the drift.  The drink of the day - obviously since it was new years day - was a bloody mary. "Two of those, please" we said. The sad truth was that they were terribly disappointing - something you'd get in a chain pub.  I ordered the carrot and coriander soup as my starter which came with a slice of bread. It was delicious. Absolutely delicious. I have no idea what my husband ordered because I was so enamored with my soup.  For the mains, the husband ordered the beef casserole with root veg and mash and I ordered the steak pie with greens and mash. The long and short of our two orders were that they were basically teh same dish. The minor differences being that mine was served in a baking dish and his in a bowl, mine had carrots and his had parsnips, and mine had a pasty "lid." Everything else was the same - a good way to go about things from a kitchen perspective.  We both really liked the beef in our dishes. It was cooked well and neither of us found fatburgs floating around in our dishes. I could have done without the pasty crust but that's a personal thing. I'm just not a pasty kind of girl. I thought the mashed potatoes paired well with my kale and steak pie but my husband commented, "Your mash is better than this mash." Thanks, I muttered.  Overall, top notch for the food (one note though is that I think there are two microwaves in the kitchen which were being used A LOT which is kind of concerning).  Service was really good but we did have one issue. I ordered a glass of wine which never arrived. When the manager stopped by our table (randomly to see how we were getting on), she asked if we needed anything and I mentioned my MIA wine and she said that she would take care of it and she did, like immediately and then told us that they had comped the wine due to the mishap. Now, this is what I expect at restaurants and, unfortunately, this level of service is just so hard to find outside of the US. Job well done, Howie's!

dokFps9UHYc6Y0Mf9rn9Ow.text: Howies is a bit of an edinburgh institution, it's been around for years and offers quailty bistro food from fresh ingredients.  having never actually been, when it was decided that this was where we would be having our work christmas lunch i was looking forward to finally trying it.  we arrived at half two on a friday afternoon and were shown to a long table along the back wall.  the restaurant space is a bit odd... on entering there is a tiny waiting area which also serves as the bar so not ideal when you're a massive party squashed in waiting to be seated.  also the space lacks atmosphere and is sort of soulless with clean walls and a mix of blues for colouring.  the restaurant is two rooms, one slightly larger than the next and these may have more atmosphere on a normal night instead of when its packed with office christmas parties.  we had barely sat down when we were offered an aperetif and had our starters placed in front of us.  i had the spicy parsnip soup, which was quite nice and a good sized portion.  starters were shortly followed by mains of which i found my venison stew tasty but not overly impressive.  the stew compromised of venison, carrots, and a serving of mashed potatoes.  i thought it could have used a few more veg to round it out but found it to be nice just not that exciting.  finally dessert arrived in speedy time and i was quite pleased with my cheese board.  three different types of cheeses, quince, and a good number of oatcakes.  i would have appreciated being told what the cheeses were though...  so overall i thought Howie's was ok, it was nice enough that i would go back to try it on a non-christmas dinner basis but not so nice that i would go rushing back.  the part that really bothered me was that the whole meal felt like we were on a conveyor belt in some factory instead of there to enjoy a nice meal.  we were in and out in just over 2 hours which isn't really enough time to enjoy a three course meal.  hopefully if i make a repeat visit i'll be able to update my review with a further star.

q2AiRmAydEy5EtmD2VKJLA.text: Howies Restaurant was recommended to us by our tour guide because we wanted to eat Haggis.  The maitre de was very serious when she greeted us and took us back to a rather charming dining area. The carrot coriander soup was spicy and delicious. Skink was food - a Scottish fish stew.  I tried my first Thistly Cross Cidar that is made just 10 miles away and it was refreshing.  The Haggis was fantastic-I am officially a Haggis Fan!  It was peppery, savory, and filling served with mashed sweet potatoes and mashed turnips.  My family also ate the lamb stew that wad super.  Would come back here for the delicious food.

B8-xbMZACf6d3Ev60dKfig.text: The pigeon was excellent, best pigeon I've ever had. They undercooked it slightly which is great for pigeon. perfectly seasoned, beautifully presented.  The salmon, however, was under seasoned an overcooked. They didn't include the skin nor any lemon. I seasoned it myself and acided it and it was ok.  However the service was unfortunate. As the lunch service got busier, the staff couldn't keep up with anything. My water was refilled only sparingly, and only after asking, and it took two tries to ask for lemon. Even the lemon that came was oddly cut.  Overall, good food, very poor service when busy. I think it's because it's understaffed slightly. Probably a lot better when there are less people.  They also included a service fee, which is the first time any Scottish restaurant has done so for a group that is not large. I will be the one to decide whether you deserve a tip. And in this case, clearly not.  Disappointing. It's also taking forever for them to pick up the check. Tunnel vision.

hmpdav4Qe1n2O1a9BLEeOw.text: Also a place I'd passed by, peeked in, and made a mental note to visit.   It's upscale without being pushy. I mean the decor. It's warm, but elegant; sparse but comfortable. My friend and I both remarked on how nice it was. There are a lot of staff, which is luxurious. Someone took my coat, someone sat me, another brought water, maybe one of the earlier ones took our order, a different one delivered it. It was funny, because usually you'd strike up little conversations with your waiter, but here it was always someone new, and if you were boring/naughty you could just keep saying the same things.  Anyway, the food was good. Not great, not WOW! It was tasty. I'd be fine if someone suggested this place again. A note on their Gluten Free options: some menu items have the little GF symbol, but it means they CAN be GF, like if something listed which sounds like it has gluten is taken out. For instance, one of the desserts was a pannacotta with a ginger biscuit and whatever. But to be GF there would be no biscuit. Not that there was also a GF ginger biscuit. So kinda disappointing in the level of accommodation.

DEUtVpz8KREoND_Tb3mWqg.text: Decent food, reasonably priced and in a central location. Came here while visiting the area with my fiance.

pjk7IA2Ddo8osT4M_-oeFQ.text: The best place we found on our trip to Edinburgh..Had a wonderful dinner of Lobster, for me and steak for my husband.  We loved the food, service and atmosphere.  Will recommend to anyone going to Edinburgh.

6ytYtxsSWeF3-ltGfvsWQQ.text: Good food. Horrible service. Our waiter Miguel was very elusive. Never came around to refill our water glasses. Never came to ask if we wanted a second drink. Cost the restaurant extra revenue because we were both hoping to order two more single malts. Never asked if we wanted dessert. Just plonked down the check and said "10% service charge is already added". Heh, tip included for a table of 2. No wonder.   Very disappointed. And the owners should be too because this arrogant waiter cost them 25 quid in extra revenue.

A53XpPwEBi7G3KQmqTRXYw.text: This a proper Restaurant, not pub, on the dopest street in Old Town.  Classy interior, refined servers and hostess.  Tasty options for the prix fixe lunch menu.  Swanky and deelish.  This place is definitely for moi.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A real swank resto.  Not a pub. A proper resto.

NUYogYcY58LacUKiyKrtJw.text: A friend recommended Howie's as a nice dinner location during our short stay in Edinburgh. We ordered the Haggis starter, the salmon and the casserole of the day. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great.  My only complaint is that our server wasn't very attentive/nice. It seemed like every person in this place was extremely friendly and nice ... except OUR server. Every time he came to the table, he seemed annoyed that he had to speak to us (he also forgot to bring the bread and then charged us for it twice on the bill). At one point, when I made eye contact with him and asked for the check, he literally rolled his eyes at me when he thought I wasn't looking.   Other than our server, this place was perfect.

k1sdN-MpIXQ-SgRWI_mG4w.text: Decent food. Well prepared and presented. The salmon was of great quality but was a bit bland. Had to add salt. Portions are fairly small so order a lot. Calamari appetizer had literally 5-6 rings. My wife ordered the lobster special with champagne. Tastes great, but the half lobster was on the smaller size compared to the ones in USA. Quality of the food was great. They have a kids menu which is awesome. Soup, main and desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Irn bru. Bubble gum flavored soda. #1 national soda of Scotland.
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Carrot ginger soup
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Calamari

K_C6HkPh28UtmmhJ9eDzXw.text: We stumbled upon this casual restaurant for dinner on a recent visit to Edinburgh, and had such a lovely dinner, that we came back for lunch the next day for our last meal in the city, only to be sadly disappointed. Our dinner was a 4-star, and our lunch a 2-star, so I split the two with a 3-star rating.    For dinner, we had perfectly cooked steak filets (mine medium-well, my friend's medium), tasty cocktails and wine.  And THE DESSERT. Just come for the dessert: This restaurant serves the BEST Banoffee dessert that I have ever had.  If I hadn't been so full, I would have ordered another on the spot.  So we did the next best thing and returned for lunch, with a plan to start and end the lunch with Banoffee.  This dessert was consistent and didn't disappoint.  It was SO GOOD (as a starter and as a finish!).  My friend ordered a lunch special with tomato soup (it was fresh, she added butter, but I like mine without), and a ravioli (which was bland and strange and in a watery broth that fell flat and severely disappointed).  I ordered the filet special again, but instead was brought a different (and less tasty) cut of steak.  When I pointed this out, the server politely offered to request me a new entree, but as we were already running late to catch our flight, I didn't have time to wait for them to cook a new one.  I ate it, but it certainly lacked the flavor and texture of the steak that I had had the night before.    We ended our meal with the Banoffee.  Delicious.  And for our trouble, they didn't charge us for this second dessert, which exhibits good overall sense and customer service.  While I would be willing to give Howie's another chance at a good meal, hoping the inconsistency was a rare event, my friend was so put off that she likely would not visit again.    Go for the dessert, and see what you think.  Meanwhile, I am wondering if I would perhaps be able to lure my friend back for the Banoffee alone. It was really that delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Banoffee is Delightful

88NHBTyYGxeZxW9HX6lv2g.text: We luckily stumbled upon this little gem while walking around Old Town in desperate need of some lunch. I'm quite fussy when it comes to food largely due to food intolerances but also because I refuse to eat meat that isn't at least free range. When I saw Howies sources their produce locally and that their chicken was free range I was sold. Even better the chicken dish was gluten and onion free!  Despite the restaurant being busy, we were quickly shown to a table and the service was very prompt and friendly. Our food took around 10 -15 minutes to come out.  It was delicious! The chicken was cooked the perfection, the chicken jus was tasty and the potatoes and beans rounded off the dish beautifully. I would have loved to have stayed and tried the dessert however as we were in a rush we had to go! I wouldn't hesitate to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The chicken dish, delicious!

rYWdOdWubsQxxbnNqbg9rw.text: Yummy authentic food at a fair price. Haggis was delicious followed by a lamb cassaerole better than my Mum made. No small accolade !

e_lh8CUdZgcGVchP8-QmRA.text: What a delicious night spent with friends. Loved every minute of it. Bustling atmosphere and full of beautiful food to boot. Great little find. First time here and hopefully not the last.

JUY3F6HaS3XUUu3H2rWegA.text: Food is good, but the service is lacking. First place in Edinburgh where the servers really don't care. Getting drinking water was like pulling teeth. When asked about peanut allergies they shrugged their shoulders and said "maybe at the factory?" Anaphylaxis is serious stuff, so I think we'll go elsewhere next time.

AWPzUSPWelY47onZAqWlkw.text: Visiting Edinburgh from the USA.  Looked on yelp for a review before we came. Generally I got the impression a reservation should be made but we got seats because It was just 2 of us and the table was apparently less to be desired....but we didn't mind. It was just smaller than average.   Service was nice enough. We ordered the haggis which was AMAZING! I also got the beef casserole which was. Delicious. My husband got a hamburger, which was tastey. We got a dessert which was fine. Not very flavorful in comparison.  I would recommend everything except that specific desert. It was a pie, with bananas bordering the  crust.

F5fay9vtCYMacONcgY9IVQ.text: Exceptional service: friendly staff (host and servers) explained the menu and answered any questions. The food was delicious and savory!  I also us the dessert (strawberries and cream) also delicious. Recommend this place highly!

JwhUgcBaxEr1lCllw6VVIw.text: High expectations of this restaurant based on some of the reviews I read...but I have to say we were sorely disappointed. The staff was friendly, but the service was painfully slow. For example, 20 minutes to get a glass of wine. The starter (soup) was tremendously over-salted to the point of being almost inedible. My companion's entree was entirely incorrect and had to be reordered. A saving grace was the "banoffee pie", which was fantastic. When the bill came, the incorrect (more expensive) entree was still on the bill, which we asked to be corrected. Also, we (Americans) were asked if we wanted to pay the service charge which had already been included in the bill...which made us very uncomfortable. Interesting that the local patrons on either side of us weren't asked about including a service charge. All in all, I would give it a C for service and a B-minus for food quality, awesome dessert notwithstanding.

5sTaNXaqMMfu_rjU68gslA.text: We are glad to have stopped at your establishment for lunch. We chose a two course and three course. The selections were good for starters, main, and dessert. I chose curried split pea soup and slow coated lamb with roasted potatoes. I loved them. Maybe I was famished. My friend had mussels, and salmon dish. We shared cake quite well done. We chose this place as we couldn't get the crispy pig skin from Oink unless we bought buns with it.

bhYGCvmOnl25OAxpE2ThWA.text: I really enjoyed the dining experience here. I had the 2 course dinner combo which was a great deal and the staff were all very friendly. I had haggis, neeps, and tatties for appetizer and the Scottish chicken breast for the main. I loved the haggis which was superb and the chicken was delicious as well, although it was a bit dry. I would definitely recommend Howies but it is a much better deal to come for lunch since they have the same menu but at a much cheaper price.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis, neeps, tatties
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish chicken breast

QOTQnBe13e3VjNFa7KrdWA.text: We ate at Howie's on a recent trip to the UK.  It was quite busy and we didn't have reservations but we only waited 10-15 minutes for a table.  The staff was very courteous and attentive.  I had the steak and my wife had the fish of the day (Hake I believe).  Excellent flavor and obviously fresh ingredients.  Without a doubt, a great experience.

RFeKwJWSUhyqZqxlP30Big.text: Enjoyed a two course lunch at Howies' restaurant while visiting Edinburgh for a weekend. I was in search of haggis and wasn't disappointed. It was delicious. For starter I tried the salmon mousse, which was a light starter to enjoy before the haggis and tatties. Lovely restaurant and informative waitresses when I visited. The complimentary short bread biscuits at the end of the meal were buttery and creamy. Nice finish to our lunch. Will visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon for main
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis and tatties

gL67Apk-dFkX7WLG3W38ew.text: The hotel we are staying at recommended Howie's as a great restaurant to go to. When I initially saw the place, I thought it would be too upscale (I'm a big fan of comfortable pubs and restaurants with amazing food).  The staff was great, the food was amazing, and the interior was beautiful (high ceilings and a clean Victorian look).  The only reason why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is that i had ordered soup and they forgot. We ended up having our soup after the main meal. The staff was very apologetic and didn't charge us for the soup (which was really good btw).

NPRZyZMVCJZG9WgFuqwARg.text: We happened upon Howies by chance and are so glad we opened the door andxtre walked inside. The roasted rump of lamb was tender and flavourful, the salmon tasty and cooked just right. The option of a slightly smaller portion of wine was brilliant . Desserts? I've had a few of those in my travels and this sticky toffee pudding will be hard to beat.  The chocolate espresso mousse was extremely  smooth, not overly rich and begged to be finished.  The service was attentive , the greeting  professionally warm.   We will repeat the visit soon .  Updated : After going through the menus and searching for a new place to try,we chucked the hunt and returned to Howies the next night. Better than ever, now our favorite place in Edinburgh.  Our highest compliments to the chef! Thank you for another brilliant dinner.

_1L87B-uL9xoEJF4eCVB1Q.text: Wonderful dinner at Howie's. Absolutely loved the haggis appetizer, fish chowder and the salmon entree. Desserts all excellent as well. Will return next time in Edinburgh!

wwPGvptZ8bvMuGdxX3eIvg.text: A great taste of Scotland in a lovely place with great service. Recommend this place for lunch or dinner.

C_8WIA9MD5S_JiORWvrTHg.text: I recommend you don't order their lobster menu because it's quite small in portion. It tasted amazing but was all gone after four bites lol. The ribeye was quite big in size and I loved their apppetizer bread+olive oil. Good ambience with a nice view of the streets.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lobster (half)
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ribeye

A2KNETjhPaLD0Vj0LcXmNA.text: Based on our tour guide, we came here for lunch.  I had the skink soup (similar to clam chowder but with skink instead of clam).  The skink (smoked haddock) held up well in the cream based soup.  It was delicious.  Then I had the haggis with neeps and tatties (turnip and potatoes).   Now I really don't know what the heck is in haggis (in theory it's heart, lung, liver, oatmeal, onion, spices and pepper), but it I like it.  It's earthy, peppery and oddly tasty.  When in Scotland, you have to try the haggis.  You have the option of ordering as an app and not as an entree. Overall, the place is bright and lively.  Although I think they are short staffed, we were served promptly.

hucl8Pir0859G72O9LkFaw.text: A solid three-star location if you're searching for Scottish food. First course was Cullen skink which was warm, but distinctly fishy. Second course was risotto. Perfect texture and flavor. Dessert was a fruit trifle (maybe rhubarb?) which I didn't like - tasted like watery yogurt and stale granola. Complimentary bread was fresh and delicious. The waiters did a great job of handling a large group; they seemed a bit frazzled, but I suppose that's to be expected.   Would've been four stars except for the noise. This place is LOUD. I wound up screaming just to be heard by someone right next to me. I think it's because of the acoustics in the room, but it really made our experience difficult to e

rnpfSpdhkMnb3Ru5Ga3TmQ.text: Amazing! Best Cullen Skink in the city. I also ordered the Haggis, Neeps, and Tatties and they were fantastic. I will be visiting again next time I am in Edinburgh.

I00h2vAr3jvHowD4w-Zf-Q.text: Howie's has an elegant interior and very friendly service, and was a lovely place for a big group of us to have dinner.  I'd make a reservation as we arrived at 5:30 on a Saturday, and by 6:30 it was really filling up. They were very accommodating with my friend's 4 year old son, as well!  They had Nanny State low-alcohol beer, my very favorite, so I applaud them for having something so tasty for preggos and non-drinkers.  I ended up getting their half lobster special - 14.95 for a half lobster in garlic butter, fries, and salad.  First, my husband and I shared the pigeon breast with black pudding, which was very good, all the other ingredients like golden raisins and pickled carrots played off each other beautifully.  The fresh-baked bread with olive oil and balsamic was a lovely thing to start with as well. You do have to pay for it, but it's cheap, so you aren't being ripped off by the bread basket.  Some of our friend started with the mussels and were really unhappy with them, and said they tasted fishy and weren't fresh.  They ended up exchanging for the haggis which everyone thought was delicious and loved. Staff were very accommodating and quick about this.  My lobster wasn't particularly hot, just warm, or particularly big, but the meat was tender and lovely, and I got big flavor from the garlic butter.  I just wanted more of it, and wanted it to feel a bit more piping hot.  The salad alongside was just some lightly dressed rocket, but the fries were golden and crisp and came in a big pile - as the lobster portion was small, I inhaled them all!  I tasted my husband's catch of the day (hake with chorizo and kale) which was good, but not as good as I hoped it would be, although beautifully presented.  Our sticky toffee pudding with ice cream was a classic example of the dish - a small portion, but extremely good and just the right temperature.  They were also very accommodating when 2 of us had to leave in a flash to make a train, letting us pay our part of the bill first and even bringing some shortbread cookies for everyone along with the bill.  We had a wonderful evening here with friends, but the food didn't stand out as exceptional.  It all looked beautiful, and some dishes were certainly better than others, but overall the presentation was superior to the preparation.

Iq2Sjk8_rnQXSOZ3iDtCcg.text: Great lunch with the family after the Scotch experience. I had the salmon, wife had the soup and salad while my daughter had the beef casserole special. All were very good. Lots of places to sit and a very friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

C_SbANNOW2KlL7ygkmyeDw.text: Howies was awesome!! Make it a stop while in Edinburgh! The Cullen Skink was amazing!! Homemade bread a daily baked casserole was incredible. Wine and beer selection was perfect. The service was spot And the added gratuity was much deserved! Loved  it

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

dgooQ8MhhlqqfXwkaPDIIw.text: Wow....this place is amazing! I came here for lunch with new friends that I had made while in Scotland. First off, they have an amazing lunch special! 2 courses at lunch 10.95 and 3 courses for 13.95. I opted for the 3 course lunch special. For appetizer, I had to try something that was traditional scottish food and ordered the Haggis, neeps & tatties. For the second course, I ordered the catch of the day, which was a pan fried hake fish. For dessert, I had Howies famous banofee pie. The biscuit base, toffee, banana & whipped cream with toasted almonds was amazing!!!! DELICIOUS food here for an affordable price. Also, customer service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Banofee pie
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Catch of the day
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis, neeps &amp; tatties

0BYBHsT1FbPcK7AtSNKVAw.text: My wife and I chose to go to Howies for our 'fancy' dinner during our trip to Edinburgh and we had a lovely time.   Part of the reason we chose Howies was because it had a reputation for making really good haggis, which neither of us had tried before. So, as you can imagine, we started off the meal with the haggis, neeps, and tatties appetizer! Overall, it was quite good, though I should mention that it is a bit spicy. It's not much spice in an individual bite, but it does build as you eat.  For dinner, I got a fish course from their specials menu which was fantastic! And for dessert, my wife and I shared a chocolate and beetroot tart which was also quite good.  Overall, I recommend Howies. They've got a great selection of high quality Scottish food!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Take your hopes and dreams home with you or place them in the trash receptacle.
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate and beetroot cake (gluten free)
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3lZQX5o67euWK-sj_24rCQ.text: We loved our experience at Howies! We arrived at 6pm and benefitted from their Early Dinner special - 2 courses for 14.99 between 5:30-6:30pm.    We loved every dish we ordered! The seared pigeon breast was served medium with pink center, delicate flavor on a bed of herbs & sprouts. The Haggis was moist, delicious and served with mashed potato & rutabaga!  For our mains, we tried the daily catch (hake) and venison haunch- the venison was slightly tough, but gamey and flavorful with brown gravy!    Definitely try the Whisky Flight if you are a whisky fan! Our waitresses were amazing - highly attentive and checked in with us for every course. We hope to be back again soon :)

9kySSa5vkeJ-lyfeLhnyQA.text: I was looking for a light lunch on our last day in Scotland, and wasn't disappointed with Howies. The placards they have outside look a bit too official and corporate, which gave me pause, but it was close to where we were staying and they had a lunch special on offer. Luckily the style of adverts outside don't define the dining experience inside.  I had the cullen skink and split the super salad with salmon, which was just the right amount of food so that I would be able to handle a big dinner later in the night.  The service was really friendly and quick, no complaints whatsoever in that department. The food was also very good as well. Cullen skink, as I'm given to understand it, is a very heavy, hearty soup, but it was delicious without weighing me down too much. It had a really nice combination of flavors. The salad was also delicious, with the salmon being perfectly cooked. The dressing was interesting - it could have used a bit of salt - but overall I was very satisfied.  Would definitely come back if I'm back in Edinburgh!

IrgtuLdTeg9LtdgPSV9Jyg.text: Our plane landed about 7:15p into Edinburgh and we knew we might start running out of dining options.  Fortunately, Howies was open until "late".   Even better the food was great!  We decided to the "Haggus, snippies & tatties" and Pigeon breast for appetizers.  Both were delicious.   I had the beef casserole - it was perfectly a spiced and cooked stew. Two folks had chicken and one of our party had the lamb.  We ended sharing bites because everyone loved there meals.   Incredibly tasty and fresh.   We shared a couple of the poached rhubarb deserts with apple sorbet.  It was a great end to a great meal.   We are only here for a short time, so I doubt we will make it back, but would all definitely recommend it.

_3xCWxQKsV1hMq4ZLFEsGg.text: What a great find on a small road. The food is solid, and it made for a perfect first meal in Edinburgh for me. I got the casserole of the day (beef), and husband got the venison. We also had cullen skink, which I'd never heard of, but is apparently a classic. I asked what vegetarian haggis was, and it was described as vegetables made to taste like real haggis. I wish I tried their haggis (vegetarian or classic). The casserole was solid, and the venison was quite good. I LOVED the cullen skink. Service is wonderful, vibe is casual (great after a day of travels and adventures), and prices very reasonable.

SPP3axLLWc4UG0VUDvjREQ.text: Great place at a great location. The prices are phenomenal considering the quality of the food. The atmosphere is nice with plenty of room and no pretentiousness. Only negative is that they staff is pretty aloof. They do get to you eventually, but don't come here if you are in a rush or if you are an impatient American. The staff is fun, but that may be the issue. They have so much fun interacting with each other, that I think they can forget about the customers. Just come here relaxed and chill, without other plans, and have a great meal at a great price.

R8X7yJ_99jlOVysZol0I-w.text: More than just a big pile of yum, and helped along by a very good value meal deal. We did book a table which I think is a must if coming here on a Friday or Saturday. I will get the food out of the way although to be fair it as expected is the main event and was more than a little tasty.  Starter: Warm salad of seared wood pigeon breast with bacon, croutons & sherry vinegar dressing Main: Fillet of Shetland Salmon with a scallop beignet , crispy herb polenta & caponata sauce Pudding: Duo of Sorbet (blackcurrant and Lemon for me).  I have to say the food was excellent with one minor floor with my starter, the croutons were more like stale bread rather than their description but all in all I really enjoyed the entire meal. The staff were polite and knew there stuff, even the one who needs to speak a little slower in order to be understood (but still charming). I certainly would recommend this place to people if you are visiting Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon with polenta chips and roasted vegetables

Hq4WFelR4byRJDHRagpCxw.text: We came here on a stop on a food tour and had the cullen skink soup.  My husband loved it, I thought it was okay, but I'm not a fan of smokey flavors.  We decided to come back for dinner.  It received only 4 stars because they were busy and service became slow.  The meals were delicious!  Pan fried gnocchi, beet root for me and the ribeye for my husband.  Both were great!  I am normally a filet fan, but I have to say it was one of the best cooked pieces of beef I have had.  The sticky toffee pudding was ok.

66JVbHazo6ecKDLrZ3gF-A.text: The restaurant was part of a Walking Food tour of Edinburgh. We had the smoked haddock chowder. It was wonderful. Gently smoked haddock with leeks and potatoes is a wonderful cream base. Perfect. Second best that I've ever tasted. Only thing me better is at Lobsta Land in Gloucester Massachusetts! will surely be back for a complete dinner here. They've been in business since 1990 and I can see why. TRY THIS PLACE!

xPjVWixrKgsHPva7KAKjpA.text: What an incredible surprise. We stopped for lunch at Howies purely because it was convenient during a wander in old town. But inside we discovered a truly fine restaurant with incredibly good food at unbelievably low prices, attentive staff, and a relaxed ambience on the side of elegant.  Perhaps a good reason to move to Edinburgh. We will certainly be back!

n0aJO3-VgaAhvZi7DD8EEA.text: Went to Scotts Kitchen upstairs. It's not on here, but excellent!  Just walk in & try anything.

DysRTG6ovuUoJryQHTrL7g.text: I went to Howies for dinner and had cullen skink which is a Scottish fish dish. It tasted good but the dish was pretty small, so you don't get much bang for your buck. I can say that the prices aren't cheap but the food is tasty and the ambience is pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

-x17F1YEvpY15ol88rHXSw.text: Went to this place for lunch based on a recommendation by our tour guide.  It was around 1:30 on a weekday but it was still fairly full which is always a good sign.  Server was pleasant and friendly.  They had a nice deal where you can get 2 dishes for around 9 pounds. I had the Haggis with nips and tatties(that's turnips and potatoes for those of you who are scratching your heads) and the salmon with potatoes served with a tomato based sauce.  The bread served was decent, I just don't like when they serve the almost frozen butter. Anyway... Food came pretty quick. The Haggis dish was delish the salmon I didn't like that much because the tomato base sauce didn't really work for me.  The check was served with a couple of cookies. I asked the server to add a 20% tip to the bill but she said there's an optional service charge of 10% which covers the tip. So no need.  So it was a great deal for pretty decent food and fast, good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis with nips and tatties. First time I had Haggis and I really liked this
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon with potatoes and a tomato vinegar base sauce

4KYCSdtUTtx_Lzskptml5w.text: Excellent food. We ordered the gnocchi, tender stem broccoli, and banoffee pie for dessert. Every dish had such a unique flavor combination, and I am so sad that as a foreigner visiting Edinburgh, I won't have the opportunity to eat this food back home. I appreciate the seasonal menu, and highly recommend the three dishes we had! Although I'm sure the other dishes are excellent too:)

jDyJGBbHbNypZJqAGjmzhA.text: Scottish food is not for me.  I wanted to experience real Scottish food so I ordered a whisky sampler and gnocchi. But, I actually really dislike whisky and gnocchi. I still wanted to give these items a chance and hoped that Howies, a highly ranked Scottish restaurant, would change my opinion of the country's food. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. I regret ordering the items I had chosen because I'm sure the restaurant offers food that I would've enjoyed.  --  taste / 1 aesthetics / 5 vibe / 5 service / 3 price for quality / 2 OVERALL / 3

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. gnocchi
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. whiskey sampler menu
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

itc-Js4vrpM_WOJOg61RFA.text: We chose this place for Lunch time, as we have Scottish specialties for a good price. The restaurant atmosphere itself is simple and warm.  The waitress was friendly and nice. The service was good and fast. I had the Salmon and even if the quantity is not big, the quality was perfect. It was served with vegetables and perfectly cooked. I really enjoyed it. My friends ate the Haggis and the gnocchi and same, good food with a lot of flavours. I totally recommend this place for nice and cheap Scottish specialities!

UQQwfqX6FjGwgZqmeb6_QQ.text: Food is excellent.   Nice atmosphere.   The manager helped us pick a good whisky.   Can't go wrong with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Relaxing dinner in Scotland

0O3ILyHSNq1xO-aYzkNtHA.text: We stopped here on two different occasions in one night.   For dinner: mushroom soup (the single special menu item) was bland and tasteless.  Haggis was mushy/watery.  Heads up - they ask if you want bread and olive oil but don't tell you it's a charge of 1.6 pounds.   We decided to come back later for dessert because we thought the banoffee pie looked good.  We stood there in the foyer for a good five minutes as someone (the owner?) behind the bar was rustling about and two waitresses walked to and from the bar.  Not a single person acknowledged us the entire time we were standing there.  Felt like I was being purposefully ignored! Finally after ~5 minutes I asked if there was seating and I was told a flat 'no'.  It was 9:15pm and the restaurant closes at 10pm. We could clearly see there were open tables.  If she had only asked I would've mentioned we just wanted fast dessert.   Overall really mediocre food and terrible, rude service.

GOKIy4sC_qwWICpAjfgkWg.text: Awesome vibrant place. Highly recommend this place for service and great food. Scottish accent doesn't hurt either!

lf7kSjpLOIB3rpEx2L-V8A.text: Located on the gorgeous Victoria Street, this is one of the best places in town to get Cullen Skink (a classic Scottish dish of creamy fish soup). The food is consistently good and their lunch specials are really affordable too.

wojdsApQeiPHqzoO9bw_ww.text: This was the best meal we had in Edinburgh by a mile. I was surprised by these things:  -The prices are totally reasonable -The food is DELICIOUS -And all this is in a super touristy, busy restaurant. (We were there during Fringe, so maybe it was busier than normal)  You wouldn't expect these 3 things to go together!  We got the prix fixe menu. My soup starter and salmon entree were delicious and thoughtfully prepared. For dessert we had sticky toffee pudding and banoffee pie--both were INCREDIBLE. Overall we were extremely pleased!! We had to wait about 30 minutes for a table but it was worth it. Definitely make a reservation!

E76oqpD747J3HSGaLBGBRA.text: Great food, great service, lovely staff! Cozy and warm environment, would definitely recommend and would definitely go back next time I'm in town!

LQJOaihIyK7xzPnXXkibPA.text: My husband and I were in Scotland for a week and our meat at Howie's was our overall favorite! My husband got to try haggis for the first time which he enjoyed. He also really enjoyed his lamb dinner. I was excited to try Scottish salmon, and Howie's pan fried salmon was AMAZING. I compared all of the salmon dishes for the rest of the trip to this one! I was also thrilled to find a smoked carrot and vegetable appetizer, which we split and enjoyed. It was nice to have some veggies on the menu since I noticed that most Scottish menus were very heavy in general. Definitely try Howie's for a modern spin on Scottish food, and get the salmon!

WBlznSWlCKBEhHi-075wPg.text: I've been in Edinburgh visiting for a few days now and this is the best dinner my mom and I have had so far! Great selection on the menu. We got the house made bread, olive oil/balsamic, hummus, and olives to start. The hummus and bread was amazing. For my main I got the pan-fried gnocci (more than delicious) and my mom got some sort of chicken dish with cauliflower puree and roasted potatoes. She loved it. For dessert we had the howies famous banofee pie (amazing) and the scottish cheese sampler! Cheese sampler was okay, my mom and I like to try new things, but since we are just visiting and haven't had Scottish cheese before, we didn't like it very much. But if you like cheese, I recommend it. We got their early dinner deal (2 courses for 14.95, Sunday-Thursday, from 4:30-6:30?) which is more than a great deal! Highly recommend Howie's.

i3Ol88sFB9fUYgamXMnmRA.text: We found this restaurant on Yelp on our way to the castle.   Our waitress was super friendly and made some awesome recommendations. I can't remember her name but she was French. We started off with a few orders of bread and some drinks. The bread, which comes with oil and balsamic vinegar to dip in, was highly addicting! It was hot and fresh.  Our drinks were amazing! I ordered the gin spritz which was refreshing.   For my main meal I ordered the pan roasted chicken breast, served with potatoes and green beans. The portion was tiny and the chicken was a little bland. I wouldn't recommend the chicken dish. My boyfriend ordered the salmon and loved it.   For dessert, we ordered the toffee cake. Must get! Authentic and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding

ZtSvcP8EhllLS7pNpDpeZw.text: Good food! We came for the 3 course lunch.   Starter = Cullen skink. So good. Full of flavor, perfect portion. Bread was also very fresh. Definitely the highlight of my meal. Entree = Chicken. Chicken was cooked perfectly and so we the veggies. I thought the entree was just okay, though. The sauce was a bit bland. I felt like it was missing something, but not sure what. Dessert = banana/biscuit pie. Good, but way too much whipped cream! We wound up scraping 90% of the cream off. It was just overwhelming and too thick.  Service was pretty awful, unfortunately. The restaurant itself is beautiful and it is in a great location.  Overall, I would come back.

dVcgIC7lDc4iRFbNnZguFA.text: An excellent meal with great service. Really good traditional but modern Scottish menu with focused on seafood with other options. Cullen Skink and Haggis FTW. Fish main plates were all delicious.

ivc1xbCdqyQqBwJJEKxq6A.text: High yield: A scottish restaurant that offers truly scottish fare such as cullen skink, venison casserole, Atlantic Hake, catch of the day, salads, and soups but with aloof service despite a cheerful and nice environment. Prices are very decent, less than 10 pounds and large portions   Food: Great food and truly a must for those who want to experience Scottish food experience. We ordered the Atlantic Hake, Venison Casserole, Cullen Skink. I give them a 5/5 for food  Cullen Skink- it's a fish chowder with potatoes and is super hearty and delicious. I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Scotland- flavor is warm and comfortable and great for a cold day. You can get it as a bowl or as a main entree.  Venison Casserole- Tasted like a beef stew with carrots and on top a dollop of Mashed Potatoes. highly recommend too, cuz where else you gonna eat Venison?? And the price was less than 9 pounds.  Atlantic Hake: There is catch of the day, which usually is Salmon but to me if you're gonna try out a Scottish dish, go for their local fish which is this hake. it is a white fleshed fish that is a very soft version of tilapia or even Halibut. It's not chickeny or fishy tasting, and doesn't have that flaky feeling that some ocean fish have. No bones inn this fillet and comes with veggies underneath.   Service: i won't lie but this what prevented me from giving them the 5/5. I have never seen such rude/aloof service in all of Edinburgh. Staff was like robots doing their job for sake of doing rather than actually caring about the customers. We asked for hot water refill and that took forver, and saw our waitress busying herself with setting up tables etc that were items I felt could have waited. We asked her to take a photograph and she kept saying 2 mins while she finishes with another customer... and another customer.... and another. When she did serve us, very cold and kind of insincere. so I have to give her a 2/5 for service. The other waiters also seemed like that too except the drinks guy in the front.   Price: Everything less than 10 pounds. No reason why anyone would not give this place a shot if they are wanting scottish fare.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Atlantic Hake with kale
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Venison casserole

YXEA11Ymz1-DK0pMiZNMXw.text: Attracted by the many favorable YELP reviews ( and a friendly tip from a fellow traveler at our hotel),  we felt we had to give Howies a try.  Both the digital and human assessments were on the money! Howies is a must stop for the weary traveler in search of authentic Scottish fare. Our meal was delightful and delicious. Don't be afraid of the haggis, It tastes like meatloaf, bu a bit grainier! If you want a more thorough review, check out Sandy J's 12/28/2106 review.  She said it all!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hk-TQpIq6OESaw5AwkNx1g.text: Couldn't leave Edinburgh without one last haggis.  We came to Howies for the super affordable lunch specials (10.95 for 2 courses, 13.95 for 3).  I did the two courses. I had the haggis as my starter, and the poached salmon as my main. If I had to do it all over again, I'd do the haggis as my main, because it was damn good. Portions were a bit tiny, but that's to be expected. The salmon was good, but nothing to write home about.  Would definitely recommend stopping in for lunch!

b1I7wUeFUm4gYY93gt3cAg.text: First time to Howie's. Went based on Yelp reviews. Was not disappointed. I had the catch of the day special - Hake. It was cooked perfectly along with peas,  zucchini and  potatoes in a lemon bearnaise sauce. My husband had the Woo Hoo Scottish lobster special with fizz and loved it. Great service. Highly recommend.

s88NawBAMol_oOm1iFTvmQ.text: Lovely little local producing consistently good food at reasonable prices for the city centre. Staff are friendly & helpful. Chef does a good range of specials.   We had the sea bass with crushed potatoes and the lamb casserole for mains. Both decent sized portions and full of flavour.   If you want a decent meal  you won't go wrong here. Solid 3.5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Quite witty

kJwuf1kVe4hF8xx1Q15lIA.text: Probably the best meal and dining experience we had in Edinburgh. Could have been 4 stars, but considering the other restaurants we visited this one deserves 5. You'll have to book ahead. We walked in on a Friday night and were politely told there were no tables available for any time that night, so we went ahead and booked for Saturday.   We started with focaccia and the trio of olives, hummus, and olive tapenade. The tapenade was a little dry, but the bread was delicious, as were the olives. We then tried the haggis and Cullen skink appetizers. The haggis was delicious, and by far the best we had on the trip. If in doubt, try it! I didn't care as much for the Cullen skink, but maybe it just wasn't to my taste - a little too salty for me.   For mains we had the salmon (wonderful), lamb (although the accompanying lentils were undercooked), soup of the day (sweet potato and coconut - good), and ribeye with frites. My steak was well cooked, but it lacked flavor a bit. It was good, but I would choose something else if visiting again.   For dessert we had the poached rhubarb, banoffee pie, brownie, and sticky toffee pudding. All were good. The pudding was decadent, and I was glad there was accompanying ice cream, which cut the sweetness.   Make a booking - you'll enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Good non-alcoholic drink.
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Good non-alcoholic drink.

WgzBi61tBkqWVj0ZN8Xqyg.text: Happened across this gem by chance and took advantage of their lunch special - 2 courses for 11.95. Ordered the haggis starter with neeps and tatties (which was the first time I ever tried haggis), it was absolutely delicious! My husband ordered the Cullen Skink which was also very delicious!  I had the Scottish salmon for a main and it was cooked to perfection, seared perfectly on the outside and deliciously succulent on the inside. The mash was super flavourful and creamy...don't want to know the calories in the plate but it doesn't even matter, it was so good!  My husband ordered the casserole of the day and he said it was delicious. Even their bread was tasty...fluffy but crispy on top with the flavour of olive oil.  I highly recommend stopping here if you find yourself on the royal mile!

y-jaNpcmE4WYXZzelK8aCQ.text: Scott the bartender provided great customer service. He recommended the pigeon & haggis for starter, main lamb and the fish of the day which was hake in a brown butter hollandaise sauce. The starters and mains were perfectly sized and we did not feel overly stuffed at the end of our meal.  Bottle of wine recommended by Scott was also very good - Pinot noir By Domaine de Valent Liam was our server and did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish of the day - Hake
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

0zCeUpek4u-a5aieN9iD1w.text: We had a wonderful welcome---we started with haggis, neeps and tatties. My love got a steak and he said it was one of the best steaks of his life. I had the rump of borders lamb and particularly enjoyed the mint and pine nut pesto. Great wine selection and a very memorable meal. This is not your average food and staff was helpful and efficient throughout which made it a lovely dining experience, would highly recommend to foodies.

aIVOzP8pffpOxrnz8jNyew.text: Such a lovely experience here to end our time in Scotland. The mabience of this place is spacious with the tall ceilings, elegant and bright with natural light. We were sat at a nice table near the window. We ordered the lobster and the lamb. Both were cooked perfectly and paired well with our Happy Hour champagne. Our server was sweet and took good care of us. The bread was fresh and we left happily after some tea. Thank you for a lovely time.

yELYHWpClZjVtAZV4QDTPQ.text: I was in Edinburgh in September 2018 for a conference, and had MUST. HAVE. HAGGIS. on my to-do list. Strangely, the entire conference - which was a big one - went by with nary a smidgen of haggis, anywhere, for any meal.  I know, weird, but there you are.  There was no way I was leaving Edinburgh without my haggis, so I scouted 'round here on the Yelp, which revealed that Howie's was a solid choice. Fact-checked that with some Edinburgh-local colleagues, and made my booking for a table on my last night in the city.  It was perfection. Service was stellar, the haggis was some of the best I've had (spent teen years in the UK, family lived in UK again later, so I got haggis knowledge) over a lifetime, and the grilled hake I had as a main course was a dream.  If you're in Edinburgh, check out Howie's (there are a couple, IIRC) - they do it up right.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hake that swam right to my heart. In a good way.
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis with neeps (right) and tatties (left) - perfection on a plate.

GSpyCCllWS5N_BZ5BY-8BA.text: Got word from our tour guide to try the haggis here and were so glad we did! We came here for lunch and got the haggis as an appetizer. We never tasted it so we didn't want a full batch if we couldn't finish it.   Definitely wish we got the full size because it was scrumptious! The appetizer was actually a good amount of food. The whiskey sauce was yummy and the neeps and tatties were both great. The haggis itself was full of flavor and depth and had a hint of spice to it that I didn't mind at all.   We tried to come back for dinner but the price for the full dish of haggis is higher for dinner so beware of that. It's a bit pricey but I'd rather have pricey yet good quality haggis than not! We also had the fish special that day and it was fresh and the veggies were perfectly cooked!!! We had the Duck app and that was perfect. The stew of the day was STUNNING. I had nothing that I didn't like!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

jxLp3sNcexhY63qs7rFAbw.text: Discard any preconceived ideas of the name conjuring up a burger place! This is a first class restaurant with a wonderful ambience and excellent service. The two of us were not ignored despite a large family group next to us. But the wait staff is not obtrusive either. Be adventurous and try  the Cullen skink a thick creamy fish soup made with smoked haddock and you will not be sorry! The hake and Scottish salmon were perfect and dont miss the "famous" bannoffee for dessert!

y8dYb7mTr-pH9lq_16rvDQ.text: Howies was my very first meal in Scotland, which set a nice precedent for the rest of our trip. My husband and I ate here for lunch and were very impressed by the the simple, yet elegant, atmosphere. The staff was professional, and the food was fresh and thoughtfully prepared and plated. We had Scottish highlights such as cullen skink, mushroom soup, leek risotto, and pan fried hake (catch of the day). I thought everything was spot on, including the complimentary bread.   How would I describe Howies in two words? "Scottish bistro," if that makes any sense. They feature fresh, locally sourced ingredients. The chefs give a damn about presentation and attention to details. It's a good compromise between having to go to a pub or a high-end restaurant for a meal. I thought prices were very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pan seared hake.
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cullen skink.
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Leek risotto.

mkLPJxMLMeGRiFyIVRFXDg.text: In my opinion this is a five star restaurant.  I ate here twice: lunch and supper.  I took advantage of the early bird special pricing.  For supper I ordered mussels for my starter and the it were luscious; prepared to perfection.  I had the Cullen Skink (fish chowder) and it is the only chowder I have eaten in the past 50 years that is comparable to the clam chowder served at San Francisco's Normandy restaurant.  It's velvety smooth with potatoes, onions and fish cooked exactly as anticipated. The next day I returned for lunch and again mussels for the starter and again, perfectly prepared.  For my main course I had the Scottish dish everyone dares another to try; haggis.  It was served with mashed potatoes and a mashed orange colored squash in a smattering of brown gravy.  All I could taste was the spices used in the haggis, especially the pepper.  Haggis is mostly Scottish oats and that's the texture.  Supposely, finely chopped or ground beef "innards".  Now many people of my generation (my assumption) grew up eating most of an animal's organs but younger Americans not so much.  Nonetheless, the plate was tasty and very filling. The service was excellent and cordial.  The atmosphere is comfortable and unpretentious.  I can highly recommend this restaurant.

kbXppDAGL-RwLrFVJb7a4A.text: Amazing salmon salad and entree with catch of the day. Also their kids 3 course meal is amazing: mushroom soup followed by fish. We loved the ambience as well.

mNX6e0NskLymt6epbnpPkg.text: Such a great experience! Friendly service, quick food preparation, and some of the best flavors in all of the UK! The chicken was absolutely delicious. It was packed, but our server was so attentive and kind. Also, their bread is...otherworldly. And their olive oil. I don't know how it's so goddamn special, but it really, really is.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The chicken, prepared with spinach and scalloped potatoes. ORDER THIS IF IT&#39;S STILL ON THE MENU!

XTdHwOE1nwhqvsEjjsYKRg.text: We were very fortunate to get a table here, with many thanks to the desk staff at the Radisson Hotel! Our party of four had a terrific dinner - Cullen Skink, delicious - sun choke arancini, excellent - gnocchi, superb - and some of the most luscious desserts - banofree pie, stewed rhubarb and apples and the chocolate brownie! All were very good and the price was reasonable. The staff and service was also great! All in all a terrific place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

OykgxN2Ag-J4YYhGB5AVUQ.text: This was one of the better meals we had in Edinburgh. While the portions are small, the tastes are good. My wife had the chicken. I had the salmon. The food came out alarmingly quickly, but was still very flavourful and hot. We were in and out in under an hour.  The service was just fine.  The only disappointment to our meal was the Banoffee pie. We ordered it based on previous reviews. I would give it a miss.

XX5wbKb2ZUJiaDLdm7vG-A.text: This is a great restaurant with many vegan and vegetarian options. The menu is interesting and varied. Such a lovely oasis among many overly touristy places. Great wines as well as whisky flights.   I arrived jet lagged and hungry and left feeling great. Super wait staff. They actually asked if I was ok with the 10 service charge. After paying 20 percent in the US as a matter of course, it was refreshing and obvious that I wasn't home! Enjoy this place!

rRez-Kn_noZlmZxAMjT9YQ.text: This was by far my favorite restaurant in Edinburgh, my family came out for a vacation and we were looking for a good restaurant for a nice family dinner. Needless to say we weren't disappointed I had a starter, main course, and dessert. For my starter I ordered cured duck it came out beautifully plated before I even got to try it I was drooling haha! The duck was amazing it had a perfect balance of sauces and veggies to go along with it. Dessert was even more lovely we asked for our servers recommendation and she pointed us towards a sticky toffee pudding that was truly incredible, overall great service good prices and a truly amazing meal. If you're in Edinburgh I highly recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cured duck, this picture doesn&#39;t do it justice it was seriously beautiful plating and you could tell they&#39;d put a lot of work into it.

Ambe-Tbfpp0H39-Pg2hyjw.text: I'm not a fan of haggis overall, but I liked it here. I even had multiple bites of it. I think the haggis was a good flavor and texture combo with the neeps and tatties. We also had the salmon dish, and also the buttery roasted vegetables which were also very good. In addition, we had a flight of whisky. It was nice to dine in a non-pub setting for variety. We showed up just in time for their early diner special. Get there before 6:30pm to get a deal on a 2-course or 3-course menu. We were too stuffed to try the banoffee pie. We saw a couple next devour it in a matter of minutes, so it must be good.

FXkFLcOIn0SPCmSZKjJotw.text: There was about half hour minutes to 45 minutes wait for this place and I can see why.  For entrees for two, we chose fish.  All I remembered is that it was really fresh and very well seasoned.  Then we had the banana cream pie and that was just such a great way to end a nice dinner.

Q03dP05vJhE6Y8Lg35VMZg.text: We ordered two venison dishes and they were great but what really blew me away was the TOFFEE PUDDING. Best I've ever had! Also, make sure to order the fresh bread. It was soft and warm and so perfect for a chilly, rainy night.

photos.caption: Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Howies - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

PlyBEEuWdP_5TkaqCxueVw.text: Love love love! Everything about this place was so perfect. The dim lighting and cool colors make this romantic, modern vibe. The Christmas lights added a really cozy aspect. And then the food was a standout on its own. Mmmmmmm! The Cullen Skink was creamy and warm the soul worthy. I loved my salmon entree too. Super fresh and cooked so great. Tender and moist. The staff was friendly and made us feel right at home.

TBcAq-MoFSMEUPTCEx5tQQ.text: Outstanding place!! Very celiac friendly. They had great service and fantastic food! Highly recommend.

t0yoQRCG2TC3WUvhA6eqBA.text: Despite being a chain of restaurants, Howies of Victoria Street seems to keep some of its individuality - possibly from the finest of all four of the restaurants manu's.  It's most certainly Scottish, but not as we know it Jim. Using local produce, Howies have managed to create a simply mouth watering modern and yet somehow traditional menu using Scottish classics such as Salmon and Haggis without becoming some kind of Scottish Medevil Theme Restaurant.  The restaurant itself is cozy and clean, with a brilliant atmosphere that is both buzzing and vibrant, but also intimate and close all at the same tiem.  I havent always been happy with the Howies Chain (sorry! set of four individual restaurants under the same name) but this is the nicest by a long way.
